transitdroid.domain.entities.mobiledevice

Class PhoneInputMapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • transitdroid.domain.core.BaseInputMapper<Phone>
      • transitdroid.domain.entities.mobiledevice.MobileDeviceInputMapper

  • public class PhoneInputMapper
extends BaseInputMapper<Phone>
    Author:
    TransitDroid Team PhoneInputMapper will act as a gate which inputs data from the data source layer. It inputs data to the instances of Phone DomainObjects. PhoneInputMapper is located in the Domain Layer of the Application. It communicates directly with its corresponding TableInputGateway i.e PhoneTIG. The PhoneInputMapper contains find and map methods. A user of this class can find if an object exists in the database or in-memory by simply passing the desired UUID of that object. The PhoneInputMapper will try to find it in the PhoneIdentityMap (if it is in-memory), else it will delegate finding it in the database to PhoneTIG. This class insures separation of concerns and produce cleaner code. This makes sure that SQL statements of the type "find" are kept separate in the data source layer.

      protected Phone map(java.sql.ResultSet set)
      In this method after retrieving a new Phone object from the PhoneTIG (database) it creates a new in-memory Phone object and adds it to the PhoneFactory's create clean and then adds it to the PhoneIdentityMap.

      • PhoneInputMapper

        public PhoneInputMapper()

    • Method Detail

      • find

        public Phone find(java.util.UUID id)
        find and return a Phone Object. Search in the PhoneIdentityMap and return the Phone object. If not found in the PhoneIdentityMap, pass the UUID of the object to PhoneTIG and return the Phone from the database.
        Specified by:
        find in class BaseInputMapper<Phone>
        Returns:
        Phone

      • findAll

        public java.util.List<Phone> findAll()
        find and return all Phone Objects. Search in the PhoneIdentityMap and return all the Phone objects. If not found in the PhoneIdentityMap, findAll Phone objects in the PhoneTIG and return the Phones from the database.
        Returns:
        List

      • map

        protected Phone map(java.sql.ResultSet set)
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        In this method after retrieving a new Phone object from the PhoneTIG (database) it creates a new in-memory Phone object and adds it to the PhoneFactory's create clean and then adds it to the PhoneIdentityMap. If the Phone already exists in the PhoneIdentity just load it.
        Specified by:
        map in class BaseInputMapper<Phone>
        Returns:
        Phone
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
